website_summaries.verdict: Great price point on a simple headlight restoration kit that keeps lenses clear.
pros: Doesn't require a drill or other tools to perform the restoration, as you'll operate the polishers by hand
Includes a coating that you'll apply after the restoration process to continually protect the surface of the lenses for up to 12 months
cons: Works better if the headlights are not severely oxidized and yellowed

customer_reviews.title: Don’t use it for Toyota Corolla 2015 stock lights
customer_reviews.text: The last picture shows how clean my lights were prior to the application of this product. I followed all the directions as instructed in the package. This thing completely ruined my headlights. I spent 4 hours sanding them down and getting them polished again as you can see this product deteriorate the plastic of my headlights. I would stay away from it. And to top it off I can’t even return it because amazon won’t allow me to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Opoca

customer_reviews.title: Buy extremely high grit sandpaper to go along with this kit.
customer_reviews.text: As dozens others have said, this kit works, but you have to put elbow grease in. What they should also mention is that you should get really high grit sandpaper (3000 and above) to make your life easier. I did a wet sanding with WetorDry 600 sandpaper, and wish I had bought a higher grit. It doesn't look bad, but at certain angles you can tell that it's not how it originally looked. Coating it with the spray is also pretty difficult to do evenly. I have purchased the heavy duty one for my family's car, and will try that one to see if rubbing the clear coat is better than spraying it on.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammad Bhuiyan

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT USE THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: The top 1/3 of my headlights became cloudy so I ordered this product to get rid of it. The bottom 2/3 of the headlights were still clear. After using this product, the cloudiness has gone away somewhat but the rest of the headlight went from clear to hazy. It looks terrible and now I need to replace the entire lens which will cost me $100+
customer_reviews.author: Frank T.

customer_reviews.title: Overall satisfied. The lights are not clear as new
customer_reviews.text: It worked as described. I restored 3 pairs of headlights with one kit, although the second cleaning pad got a bit ineffective on the last set of lights. Overall satisfied. The lights are not clear as new, but it did make a world of difference. In all fairness, this is not the heavy duty restoration kit, so my expectations were not that high when I started. It did definitely surpass my expectations. Still, though, not 100% perfect, hence the four stars. It is supposed to last at least one year. Now I will wait and see actually how long the headlights will remain clear.
customer_reviews.author: consumer

customer_reviews.title: Skip the kit, do plastx and then clear
customer_reviews.text: Skip the kit, just do Meguiars plastx with microfiber towels and then follow up with the Meguiars Spray clear coat from this kit ( which can be bought separately ). The pads are coarse, they scratch the headlights pretty bad, but not noticeable from far away. This kit will work for people who aren't strong, who won't put too much pressure on the headlights. Put pressure using these pads and you'll destroy the headlights.
customer_reviews.author: Camper

customer_reviews.title: It works, will see how long it last, says 1 year
customer_reviews.text: I tried 4 other head lamp cleaners, the type that you just rub on and rub off. Never tried one that actually sands it to a light frost. I was always afraid of fine sanding and the fine lines would not come off. This one works, no sanding machine, just rub on the cleaner until the entire lens is frosty, then spray on the clear coat. The lens then comes clear and very smooth. Be careful to cover the paint at least 10 inches all around. I covered one part of the paint with only 5 inches of tape and the clear coat got on the paint. Had to wax it off several times.
customer_reviews.author: D. Goo

customer_reviews.title: Elbow grease lets your light increase
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised; a few pointers: 1. The magic is in the spray, so wait for it. I was initially sorely disappointed in how the buffing/cleaning didn't seem to do anything except remove road grime from the headlights. The second step is the one that makes your light covers clear as glass. 2. There's enough here for at least two pairs of headlights. I used less than half to do both front lights on my Toyota. 3. Yellowed light covers is only reason for dimmer lights. The bulbs themselves begin to fade. Don't expect miracles from this product. It's certainly cheaper than replacing your lights. Do this first!
customer_reviews.author: Gene Koo

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job with additional polishing step
customer_reviews.text: Bought this kit to clean up headlights on Pontiac G6 If you use it out of the box as directed, you will get somewhat acceptable results. However. to achieve excellent final results you will need to polish the lens with a finer compound using a rotary polisher, This brings to lens to almost clear condition. Then apply the spray as directed. the additional step dramatically improves to look to nearly original condition. The real star of this kit is the spray sealant.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Cripps

customer_reviews.title: Done in 10 minutes both headlights were so yellow I could not see at night
customer_reviews.text: They were solid yellow I did not polish much , five minutes each would be and exaggeration, cause it was about 130 F in the street where i parked then the clear sealant spray filled in my laziny job, I just used windex spray to remove the scrubbing paste and sprayed them about 1 minute late a half of second of sealant spray mist, twice, I was done look like new, just not clear as glass. I could probably give to to next family member and it would do about 40 lights if they don't waste the spray coat finish, I just misted them twice for a total of about 2 seconds of spray for both headlights,
customer_reviews.author: New Eyes

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 50 year old heavy woman, I did this myself. It was very easy to use, & worked beautifully. we had purchased a used vehicle recently for a 2nd one, & the headlights, & foglights were in rough shape, so I got to work on them. Taped everything with blue painter's tape to protect all but the lights, I buffed them twice with the included pads & compound, I rinsed thoroughly & left to dry overnight. Gave them a quick wipe down the next day, & did the 2 layers allowing roughly 10 minutes in between coats. Now they look great! Time will tell how long it'll last. But for now I'm very happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: jmd1993

customer_reviews.title: I didnt believe it until I seen it.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I wish i took before and after pics.. i didnt think it was going to work like it did. My headlights cant get any newer looking. They are in mint condition after using this stuff... follow directions, when u put the cream on its going to be hazy/cloudy, its suppose to be so dont get worried, once u spray the lights the haze goes away and the light looks brandnew..
customer_reviews.author: TapSnapOrNap203

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I tried the method suggested by multiple u-tubers; sanding, cleaning, and clear spray coating. It came out somewhat not crystal clear. Then, I tried to rubbing and polishing after resanding and spraying. It came out a bit better, but not at the level of my satisfaction. I tried this Meguiar product as my final effort before replacing the unit followed by one other Utuber's suggestion. It worked amazingly... very easy to use and works wonder... Now, I know what to do on this issue. Thanks for this fine product made by Mequiar and thanks for Scotty Kilmer suggesting the right product.
customer_reviews.author: timonly

customer_reviews.title: This stuff WORKS
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe the results on my 2004 VW Jetta. First off, mask the headlights off well with blue masking tape. Though it's probably not necessary, I cleaned my headlights before I started. Squirt a quarter sized puddle of the first step on the rough side of the buffing pad, and go to work. Take you time, when you finish, it should look 'frosted' from edge to edge. Again, clean it up very well, let it dry. When the spray hits the headlight, you will not believe how great it works. Gave both a coat, waited an hour, gave them another coat. Unbelievable. So easy to do, very easy to recommend.
customer_reviews.author: BlindedByScience

customer_reviews.title: This product works.  Headlights and tailight lenses like new.
customer_reviews.text: Used Meguiar's wax and polish for years and was happy. Decided to try the headlight restore foggy vintage headlights, turn signal lenses and tailights on 2000 Fleetwood motor-home, 1994 Suzuki tow vehicle, and headlights on 1997 Dodge Ram. Had tried everything from toothpaste to rubbing compound, hand rub and power polisher. Those did not last six months and fogged again. Saw that clear coats always peeled after a year so avoided those. Used the Meguiar's cleaner and fog cleared right up with hand rub. Then applied their protective clear. They look like new plastic after nearly a year.
customer_reviews.author: maryjean hunter

customer_reviews.title: I wish I took before and after photos!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical and didn't take before and after pix - We tried other products on my wife's 2009 Acura TL. The car is in excellent condition and the only thing that needed 'cleaned-up' were the headlights. I was skeptical and after step one, nearly panicked because the headlights were 'cloudy' on the outside. I thought I ruined them. But I applied step two as instructed and called my wife to see if she could see the difference. Immediately, she saw the difference and all is good cuz 'mum' is happy. :D I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: dr Frank

customer_reviews.title: Magic
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. Idk how it works, but it works. The top of the headlights on our “new” car looked and felt scratched. Somehow this product made them look brand new again. TIP: make sure you have a lot of tape or newspaper covering for overspray. I thought I was doing ok, but I think some of the spray got on the top edge of the tape and maybe ran down and I didn’t get it removed in time. I can’t be 100% sure it was something I did, but I think so. Very minor—hope it remains minor. Learned my lesson on the second headlight.
customer_reviews.author: StephCorleone

customer_reviews.title: This product is fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, this is a great product. I've used a couple others and this one blows them away. It's super easy to use. The first step of cleaning the headlight is quick and easy. The second step of spraying the lights is also quick and easy. I followed the directions and after very little effort, my headlights look like new. I wish I had taken before and after photos to prove it. In addition, there is also enough product to use on about 6 other sets of headlights. The price is also extremely reasonable. I mean it, buy this stuff, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: michal

customer_reviews.title: Used only the headlight coating
customer_reviews.text: Bought this but it sat of the shelf for a while. I then saw a video that used a 3M kit to clean and polish the headlights, so I bought and used that, but finished the headlight restoration process with the headlight coating in this kit. The coating goes on clear and smooth and really makes the headlights look outstanding after it is applied. I am hoping it does protect the headlights in the long term so I don't have to repeat the cleaning process in a short amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: She-Ra

customer_reviews.title: Takes a good amount of elbow grease but it pays off!
customer_reviews.text: This kit should be anyone considering replacing their headlight's first stop. Mine in my 2008 outback were foggy and yellowing. Instructions/steps are easy enough - first you use the abrasive liquid and scrubbing pad and then spray with the curing liquid. Word of advice - when you think you have scrubbed enough, keep going another 5 minutes. The lights will look cloudy and scratched, that's correct! Mine didn't come out perfect but for an hour, maybe an hour and a half of work, they are greatly improved and saved me money over replacing them outright
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: Saved my 16 year old foggy yellow headlights!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for replacement headlights, and then products like this kept coming up in my searches. For a fraction of the cost of replacement I thought I'd give it a try. This kit really brought my headlights back. They were so bad that you couldn't even see the lamp inside the housing. Now the lens is crystal clear, and the headlights are noticeably brighter. I found it easier to remove the headlights from my van (2003 Chevy Express), rather than tape off the chrome/paint. Altogether I would say that it took less than an hour to do both lights, and have them back on the van.
customer_reviews.author: teamjt

customer_reviews.title: worse than before
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what went wrong. Followed the directions exactly. The first coat of the spray looked perfect, just like the video. Second coat and it is worse than before I started. Now I have a mess and not sure what I can do to at least get it somewhat better since the spray has acetone.
customer_reviews.author: Glen R.

customer_reviews.title: Good for light oxidation
customer_reviews.text: I liked the product. It worked as advertised. I was a bit nervous about the spray but if you follow the instructions it goes on nicely and looks good after it dries. I really don't think this product would clean up heavily oxidized lights, but I can't say for sure. I'd already cleaned mine up with the 3M three-stage sanding and polishing kit to where they were already fairly decent. But this made them look even nicer. We'll see how long the protectant lasts, but so far the lights look pretty decent for 18.5 year old units.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!
customer_reviews.text: This product exceeded my expectations. It was very some to use. I've tried afew other headlight restoration kits, and they didn't work nearly as well, and had more steps. I used it in a vehicle that was about 10 years old, that had really dull and faded headlights. One thing to know is that if your headlights are as old and faded as mine were, they are NOT going to look brand new. The improvement will be a LOT better, but not showroom clear. That being said, I was impressed and surprised at how well mine came out. Would purchase again and recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: I liked this kit because it comes with the UV protectant ...
customer_reviews.text: I liked this kit because it comes with the UV protectant coat that many of the 3M kits do not come with. However, even though the kit worked as described, I preferred using parts of a leftover 3M kit due to the multiple "grit" polishing steps available, as well as the included drill adapter. The final polisher in the 3M kit is a piece of leather or synthetic leather with little to no abrasive in it that removes haze and cloudiness. The Meguiar's kit relies on the spray to remove the cloudy finish to more of a degree than the 3M.
customer_reviews.author: Keith C.

customer_reviews.title: Actually works!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my son's headlights. We had tried several products that would work just a little bit to reduce the haze across the headlight but would not last. We ordered this product with low expectations. My son even admitted he did not think it would work. We followed the directions EXACTLY and it ACTUALLY WORKS! His headlights look Brand NEW! We are honestly so excited and surprised. I had even looked at replacing them but at $119 a piece I wanted to try this first. We are SO THRILLED!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Easier than 3 step sandpaper kits, simpler, and you get more coating to work with
customer_reviews.text: I've tried both the 2-3 step "sandpaper" headlight kits with some success, and also the drill bit kits for cleaning headlights. This Meguire's kit was much easier and lasted longer. No steps to go through, no little wet pieces of sandpaper, just put the glop on the pad and clean it, the dry the cleaner off, then carefully spray the coating on. The hardest part was probably taping around the edges for preparation. Unlike those kits with the annoying little moist towelette of headlight coating, you can spray this on much more liberally and the clear coat lasts much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Matt W

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use, results are spectacular
customer_reviews.text: This worked remarkably well for my car; my headlight covers were so oxidized that they looked "milky" and "hazy" in appearance, and I simply applied 4-5 "quarter" amounts of cleaning solution to both headlights and worked it in with the pads. I think, total, it took me roughly 40 mins to sand/buff both headlights to the point where they were looking clear. The spray then really made the headlights shine, and my covers look like glass again now. I'd highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: N8

customer_reviews.title: Works Great on 11 Year Old Car
customer_reviews.text: One thing I would add to what other reviewers have stated is to use an old sheet or something equivalent to cover your hood for overspray. Four vigorous cleanings and rag wipe off on each headlight seemed to be enough before wiping off with a damp rag. The coating spray turns your hazy lens into a clear one. It is kind of cool to see the change. I only used one pad out of two for the entire process and I think I have enough product left to do another set of the same headlights in the future if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl K.

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough
customer_reviews.text: Skeptical that their one sanding disc and polish would work.. it did though. I have the DA Power System and that made this job much easier. I got plenty left to do a few more cars. Wish I could buy the sanding discs separate. Knocked just one star because I got better clarity doing the traditional wet sanding steps on my other car. But for the convenience and results i did get, im happy. Good enough being the haze will just eventually come back anyway and the kit will be back out. :)
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Really works!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I wold say it’s easy to use but only gave it three stars because if you want perfection you will need to wet sand your lights starting from 500grit to 3000. I did use the included compound during sanding until 1000 grit then only wet sanded. About 30mins per headlight and the clear coat laid down perfect! Exceeded my expectations for a one part clear coat. So far still looks like the day I did it. Worst case if fades after a year (product states it lasts up to a year) it will be easy to wet sand at 3000 grit only (quickly) and add clear coat yearly to keep them looking brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany E

customer_reviews.title: Used G2970 2 step , works well so far
customer_reviews.text: I used the two step product with the cleaning solution and scuffing pads. I taped off edges to protect paint then I went over my headlights with 1000 grit wet sand paper first then used the cleaning solution and pads. I cleaned off headlights very well then taped off and masking paper. sprayed two coats and 5 min between coats. The product leaves a nice clear finish. The product says it lasts a year. I live in Florida and vehicle stays outside so I will see how well it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: DADDEO

customer_reviews.title: WORKS WELL, REASONABLY PRICED
customer_reviews.text: Have an old 2002 Chrysler Sebring that has been exposed to the elements for the last 10 years. Both headlights were heavily oxidized and very cloudy. Thought this Restoration Kit was a good value for performance and price per on-line reviews. Followed directions, and as you can see the results were excellent. My only minor complaint was that it did take quite a few tries rubbing and wiping to get all the worn surface off - may have been better to purchase a more expensive kit with a drill attachment if I realized the effort required. Nonetheless, it did work well. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gray Rider

customer_reviews.title: Does the job it says it does.
customer_reviews.text: My headlights were very yellowed after years in CA and FL sunlight, so I googled how to clean them and found TONS of ways to do it, involving a lot of sanding or toxic chemicals. I recently read about this stuff and finally pulled the trigger to get it done. This worked great, really impressed. Just taped off my headlights, applied the compound and rubbed it all over the lens for a few minutes. Wiped it off, let it dry, and then sprayed a couple of coats of the protectant. Bam. Clear as glass again! Will it last a year as promised? Don’t really care since it was so easy to fix. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: thecroztm

customer_reviews.title: Sealant seems good.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used 3M restoration in the past. Happy with it, but wanted to try Meguires with the Sealant spray against UV. I used the first step and it made the headlights hazy. Next step was the spray. I was scared to seal it while they looked that hazy. I ended up doing all the various sanding and polish from the 3M and they were sparkling. I finished up with the Meguires spray and it took it up a notch. May have looked the same using step one of Meguires but I was hesitant. I’ll stick with 3M
customer_reviews.author: Tbrad

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I was very dubious about this working but I have say it actually does work! One headlight was in a rougher condition then the other but it turned out good keep in mind there are levels of strength so if you headlights are severely fogged or dull make sure to get the one a level up then this ! My son has an old mustang n I will give this a go on his headlights but I’m suspicious I may need to use the extra strength product . If you make a mistake you have to smooth the surface out to then reapply but this is such an easy process nothing overwhelming! Good product and at a great price
customer_reviews.author: r.stgo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great results!
customer_reviews.text: So far it looks great! The true test of the product will be over time to see if the clarity will remain. However, application was super easy and very satisfied with the end result. It made a foggy headlight look much better, and an already clear headlight look brand new. As some reviews mentioned, I wouldn’t skip using the tape to prep the area. Also short bursts when spraying the sealer worked like a charm. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jared McGill

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly! Pretty easy to use and really did an excellent job on my headlights. They're now crystal clear and look brand new. They had a large amount of fogginess on the outside that couldn't be removed by just washing but this did the trick. I was worried because I had an older Mazda 3 in the past and had looked up similar products but the reviews were not great. So I thought I was out of luck. But then this was recommended to me. Do yourself a favor and try it out.
customer_reviews.author: R. MacKay

customer_reviews.title: What a great product!
customer_reviews.text: Follow the installation instructions and you should get great results. I restored the headlights on a 2004 Xterra and they look great. Just use the scrubbing pads to polish the headlights. Don't worry if they still look a little hazy, once you spray the clear coat is when you will see the magic happen.
customer_reviews.author: Carneytiger

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to wear gloves 🧤
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and the results are incredible. However, make sure you wear some type of rubber/waterproof gloves. The instructions don’t say to, but it leaves a weird film on your hands that doesn’t wash off. It almost makes them feel water resistant. Finally after a couple weeks it has finally worn off for the most part. Otherwise, it’s a great product and I’ll definitely use in the future if needed. Also, I had enough left over after doing both headlights to do them once again in the future. Excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: loves2shop

customer_reviews.title: Kit is not complete.
customer_reviews.text: The provided pads do not last long and each pad can barely last two headlights. Once out of pads the whole kit sits somewhere in corner of garage and will expire before next use. They also ask you to use "PlastX Clear Plastic Cleaner & Polish" which is not included with this kit. So far I have used this kit to clean two set of headlights (2 cars) and I'm out of pads but lots of cleaner left over. The headlights are holding up so far after about 2 months. We'll see if it holds during hot summer days.
customer_reviews.author: A. N. Gupta

customer_reviews.title: Simple process. Great results.
customer_reviews.text: My 15 year old 4Runner had the milkiest headlights that I could no longer ignore. After researching (everything from having a professional restore them to using a magic eraser), I decided to turn to Amazon. I contemplated using the 3m drill system, but after reading several reviews, I decided to go with Meguiar’s. As you can see in the photo, the right headlight has been completed, the left has not. The process took about 10 minutes per light, the directions were simple and easy to follow, and the results are fantastic! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat for the price
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is hard to beat for the price. My daughters 2009 Mazda6 headlights were so dim that it was like trying to drive with only the running lights. She and my husband followed the instructions and applied the product, inside of the garage where there was no wind. It has made an immense difference for a small amount of money and time. Not sure how long it will last as it was only applied a month ago, but for now we are happy.
customer_reviews.author: K&KsMom

customer_reviews.title: Really impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to do 4 sets of headlights (one kit). In the past I had tried some other products but in the end this stuff stands out above the rest. I did my headlights about 4 months ago and they still look awesome (2007 Infiniti G35). If you have foggy headlights, this stuff is the way to go. Just make sure you sand enough of the surface off before spraying on the clear coat. I made that mistake on one of the headlights I did and you could tell. That one was not quite as clear. All of that being considered, I highly recommend this as a DIY solution.
customer_reviews.author: Dyke T.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Very to use. It did not take a long to do two headlamps. There is enough product to clean at least two cars lights. (I still have some left over). The masking tape took longer to apply than the actual cleanup. Ensure that you work in shade and that the surfaces are washed and dried. I like the fact they disclose upfront that it is good for one year. I am so impressed that I am ordering one more. I have use other products in the past this is by far the easiest to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dabba

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Results!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I did 3 cars and still had lots of product to do more!!!! It cleaned up the headlights on three different cars....a 1998 Civic and an 07 Focus and my newest car a 05 Rav4..... Every single headlight was clouded before an now is crystal clear. I will post up photos later of the after results.... Edit. I have added before photos of my RAV4 and a photo of all 3 cars with headlamps cleaned!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda P.

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a fan of this product. The steps are that you sand the effected area and then spray a clear coat on the lens. Did it work? Eh.. maybe 3.5/5 stars for me on that. I don't think this is a good kit for those who don't work on cars often. It'll do a decent job, but really for a little more you could have this professionally done by a business near you. Save your money and research your other options.
customer_reviews.author: Cluecas

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavy worn lights
customer_reviews.text: Works better on lightly worn and oxidized headlights. Mine are seriously oxidized and I was only able to clean up some of the oxidation. Headlights did appear whiter than before, just not much brighter than I wanted. If your lights are seriously worn out and oxidized, I recommend using a heavy duty cleaner with the drill/sander attachment. If you just need a light cleaning then this will help.
customer_reviews.author: Alfonso Tobias

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical getting this. My Mazda 3 has had cloudy lights for years. I tried toothpaste, baking soda, nothing worked. Tried this and wow! They look brand new. I did the cleaning part 3x on the rider’s side, and 4 on the driver’s side, the worst. Let it dry, then applied the shine spray. I did 3 coats allowing 10 minutes between. It looks great! I highly advise doing the tape like I did, the spray does not really go all over but have a rag handy. I am letting the car cure for 24 hours in the garage before using it as per instructions. Now to see if it lasts a year in the Louisiana weather.
customer_reviews.author: The Senator

customer_reviews.title: Seems to have helped my cloudy headlight lenses.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2002 Miata SE, and the headlights were a bit cloudy. I applied this and it did seem to work well. I got this based on a recommendation from Miatanet. Masking these headlights were a pain, as they have some tight curves. That being said, applying this polish and spraying the sealer were easy. You must mask well, as the spray is light and will blow around if applied in a breezy setting. But this beats replacing the entire lens!
customer_reviews.author: Debra Miller

customer_reviews.title: Might’ve worked... eventually
customer_reviews.text: I was really getting nowhere with this product. Ended up buying some sandpaper and wet sanding the headlamps. I will say that i found the small can of clear coat in the kit very helpful. I feel it was easier to control the spray than had i gone and gotten a can of regular clear coat. But of course, the price is more than the value of the small can of clear coat. I’d pass on this.
customer_reviews.author: vrdaver

customer_reviews.title: Removes haze, but leaves light scratches
customer_reviews.text: My lenses only had light hazing; using the product did remove the haze, but light scratches remain. Requires further polishing. Probably should have purchases the BASIC kit, meant for less hazing, but did not realize the option was available until after I got the product. -- Amazon should show the the options for this product - Severe, Moderate, Light in the product descriptions.
customer_reviews.author: P. Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I used this product on a cloudy, overcast day. I purchased it because of the reviews and because it is not terribly time-consuming. That was a big issue for me. It worked very well with not a lot of elbow grease or effort. Each lense took about 20 minutes tops. While I didn't spend much time on them, I am very pleased with the result. NOTE: The protectant makes all the difference ... I was disappointed that the lenses weren't clear, then I put the protectant on and voila! Glad I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed! First time renewing headlight covers with a "KIT" product. Normally I've done this with sand paper and polishing compound and lots of elbow grease. Followed the directions and only used supplies included in the kit plus tape and a water bottle. Great results on a set of 21 year old lenses. The spray coating went on nice and also has a very pleasant Oder. 1st Photo shows the first lens done and the condition of the second lense before treatment. Second photo is the other side with both lenses done. Still have enough materials left for several more lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Jess H.

customer_reviews.title: True to Advertising
customer_reviews.text: For mildly hazy headlights. It wasn't super easy, as it does take a decent amount of elbow grease. After the first step it still looks hazy, but not yellow, which makes it difficult to know when you've finished. However the spray for the second step fills in the scratches, producing a fairly clear lens. Given the price is less than half a new assembly and I didn't have to disassemble the front of the car for at least a year (we'll see), seems like a good value.
customer_reviews.author: MDSG77059

customer_reviews.title: I can see!!!
customer_reviews.text: my lights are so much brighter. easy to use. however, be sure to tape off the car and other lights as recommended. to wait the 3-5 minutes suggested to see if the lights are clear after the first coat, you will need a watch. also, as soon as the first coat is off and clean, be sure to spray the sealer right away or they will fog up. well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: FAR OUT!

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is as easy as it gets. I had never done a headlight restoration before so I didn’t know know how much cleaning solution to use so I went light on the first headlight because I didn't want want to run out. It took longer and was more difficult to do and there is plenty! Don’t skimp on the product! And the second headlight came out better, too! This is an awesome product! I cant wait to see what the results are after the 24 hour curing time.
customer_reviews.author: laura stidham

customer_reviews.title: Like new headlights
customer_reviews.text: This made my headlights so clear! I used another brand 2 years ago to make my headlights shiny again, but as time goes on it got hazy again. I tried this brand and it did not disappoint and I really liked just using elbow grease to clean the headlights vs using a drill. The 1st pic was before I started, 2nd pic was after budding/cleaning using the cleaning solution, and the 3rd pic was after the second coat of the spray. Very happy with the results!
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis L.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.  Make sure you complete both steps.
customer_reviews.text: I used this stuff for the headlights on my Prius. Long story short, it worked. This kit requires a two-step process, the first of which requires you to use the compound and an abrasive scrubber. I was a little disappointed after I completed this step, and almost through the product out. I figured I had nothing to lose from following through with step two, and that did the trick. Headlights look like new.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Sunderland

customer_reviews.title: So good, it's magic!
customer_reviews.text: I don't write many product reviews but wow! Meguiar's knocked it out of the park with this product. My wife thought I bought her brand-new headlights. The compound was easy to apply. It cut right through the oxidation on the plastic. The headlights, although cloudy, showed immediate improvement. Then the magic happened. I sprayed the second step headlight coating and the plastic instantly cleared. Simply amazing! It worked so well, my next thought was, "I wonder what else I can put this on?!"
customer_reviews.author: Othello

customer_reviews.title: 370z headlights are Clear AF again.
customer_reviews.text: did what I expected it to! however be very AWARE that you are going to have to scrub your *** off for a while. Easy to do but it does take some time to actually start seeing results. You basically have to remove the factory clear coat off the headlights in order to get the clear look back. Once you do that, and you will know trust me, you apply the clear coat spray it provided. This kit DOES NOT come with any micro fiber towel which would have been handy, but just an fyi. You will need a couple of them in order to wipe and keep sanding as you go.
customer_reviews.author: joanna

customer_reviews.title: Makes a HUGE difference
customer_reviews.text: DEFINITELY worth it. I've owned my ancient car for years but I've never cleaned the headlight despite parking the poor car outside for years. The directions weren't super descriptive, so I followed the company's YouTube instructions. I'd say to scrub small potions at a time--don't go in big circles--and remember to tape your car up so that the spray doesn't get on the car. That's really it. Nothing complicated and beautiful results.
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing...
customer_reviews.text: I tried and applied this product exactly as directed, doing two to three cleaning coats per lens, buffed dry between, wiped with a clean damp cloth and dried before putting clear finish coat. While it did get rid of the yellow discoloration the lens has a dull scratchy unclear finish to it. Nothing like the clear new looking pics I'm seeing posted by other users.
customer_reviews.author: Don R

customer_reviews.title: It works !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly worked well. Cleaned up my lenses pretty good. I’m just curious if that actually improves the output. It cleans the surface , not the interior. It was simple and safe. Honestly, I feel all these headlight cleaners are all just rubbing compound dialed down a little. If you want to clean up your lenses, you won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpyoldcrab

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: This works! I probably wouldn't buy it a second or third time because I absolutely, positively will NOT be cleaning my headlights by hand ever again... but this definitely works. It takes quite a bit of elbow grease (especially if you let them get as bad as I had) but it did it's job beautifully. I am very happy with this product and glad I went with this brand. I would absolutely recommend it to others. My before and after photos:
customer_reviews.author: Spudly

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I had yellow, hazy headlights on my 2007 Z4M. After about 20 total minutes of work, I have clear, new looking headlights. I am impressed. Pro tips: 1. Definitely tape off the area around the headlights generously 2. Do it in shade because the rubbing compound dries out if you don't 3. Apply the clearcoat in THIN layers otherwise it can run. I believe the box says two medium wet layers. I think I went a little heavy and got drips as a result. Next time I do this I will go really light and do maybe 3-5 layers.
customer_reviews.author: Josh W

customer_reviews.title: Shortcut to cleaner headlamps
customer_reviews.text: This was much easier than the other options I was reviewing for cleaning up headlamps. It took me about 30 minutes to do my minivan, probably shorter now that I know how it goes. I only gave it 4 stars because the headlamps came out good, but not perfect. I don't even know if it's possible to get them crystal clear again, but this was a huge improvement.
customer_reviews.author: B. Eckert

customer_reviews.title: Easy and good results.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a couple years ago, decided not to use it, and just put it on the shelf in the garage. Today I tried it on a 2002 Toyota I recently bought that had yellowed headlights. It is extremely easy to use and the results are impressive for the cost. Not quite like new, but considering the $175 each cost for new lenses, and the trouble of replacing, this is an excellent alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the effort and the price.
customer_reviews.text: Works really well! I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of this product. It's a two step process and requires some elbow grease but I was able to achieve this result on both headlights in about 30 minutes. The clear coat spray dries in about 3 minutes and leaves a dry, residue free shine. This was the medium kit and, considering how oxidized my lenses were, I probably should have bought the heavy kit. Nevertheless, I am quite pleased with the results!
customer_reviews.author: chemtrooper

customer_reviews.title: Amazing results on instrument cluster bezel
customer_reviews.text: Used Meguiar’s Two Step Headlight Restore to repair a 3/4 x 3 inch scuff/scratch in my instrument cluster bezel. Previous owner used a scouring pad on the bezel leaving annoying scuff and scratches. Tried several cleaners without any improvement. Had great results on my headlights so tried it on the bezel and the results are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: wingman50

customer_reviews.title: Works much better than I hoped.
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t think this would actually do much. I was wrong. I think I did both headlights in less than 30 minutes, and they were pretty bad. Tip: After you’ve finished scrubbing and you’re wiping with a wet cloth, the headlight will look crystal clear for only seconds. Don’t worry - that’s normal. Make sure you dry it well and when you spray the headlight it will be crystal clear again.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Good Product. Head lamps still look great after 1.5 years.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Takes away all of the fogging - almost like new. No complaints for the money. Did both head lamps in about an hour. Get some 1.88 inch blue painters tape to frame out the headlamp so as not to scratch the car paint around it or get the spray on the car paint. You don't want either of these things to occur.
customer_reviews.author: Animadverto

customer_reviews.title: So easy! So clear!
customer_reviews.text: Thus was so easy! Ive watched lots of youtube videos showing 5 different sandpapers and powertools. This was just 1 easy cleaning solution, put on by hand. Wipe off with glass cleaner. Then spray the clearcoat. I used on both vehicles snd there is still 80 percent left in the bottles. Windows are crystal clear. Unbelievable!

customer_reviews.title: Excellent with one minor drawback!

I'd recommend following the directions the first time around (the spray is excellent!) but would suggest using sandpaper the following year/ years to come. Like I said the spray is really really good and better than the coating supplied with the heavy duty kit.

customer_reviews.author: Sgt_Retired_Gamer

customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: A perfect buffing program for plastic headlight covers!

It will probably will need to be re-done at intervals as the coating is likely to be vulnerable to my Colorado mountain sunlight and mag chloride... we will see!
customer_reviews.author: John Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Surprised how good the results are.

I had alcohol ready for after I sprayed to clean up the over spray.
customer_reviews.author: popie

customer_reviews.title: It works and it's easy!

Can't believe I waited that long to fix my lights - my car looks so much better now!

I think that the before/after photos tell the story well.
customer_reviews.author: Hi Desert

customer_reviews.title: One of the Better Headlight Lens cleaner/restorers available

product_meta.title: Meguiar's Headlight Restore 2step
product_meta.description: Meguiar’s Two Step Headlight Restoration Kit allows you to restore your headlights quickly and easily. First, clean the surface evenly using the cleaning solution and abrasive cleaning pad (included), and wipe off with a microfiber cloth. Then spray the surface with the headlight coating until evenly and thoroughly coated. This will restore the plastic to a crystal clear finish and provide protection from re-oxidation, keeping your headlights clear for up to a year. This simple two-step process makes removing oxidation, cloudiness and yellowing quick and easy, while providing brilliant, long-lasting headlight clarity.
feature_bullets: RESTORE HEADLIGHT CLARITY: Quickly and easily restores clarity to oxidized and yellowed headlights
YEARLONG PROTECTION: Revolutionary coating protects against yellowing and re-oxidation for up to 12 months

ONLY TWO STEPS: Simply apply the included cleaning solution, then the headlight coating – no drill required. Makes removing oxidation, cloudiness and yellowing fast and easy while providing brilliant, lasting clarity
BETTER VISIBILITY: Enhances visibility and safety for night driving
NO DRILL REQUIRED: Delivers crystal clear finish without sanding or the need for a drill
